title: Paula Abdul weighs in on Katy Perry’s rumored ‘American Idol’ salary: 'Good for her'
text:
CLOSE Kelly Clarkson looks back on the 17th anniversary of her American Idol victory Harrison Hill, USA TODAY

There's no "Bad Blood" between Katy Perry and Paula Abdul – despite the differences in their "American Idol" pay.

During an appearance on "Watch What Happens Live With Andy Cohen," a caller asked Abdul how she felt about Perry reportedly making $25 million for judging the "American Idol" reboot.

"Well, good for her, good for her," Abdul said. "Why not?"

In an interview with Entertainment Tonight in 2017, Abdul confirmed her paycheck was smaller.

"Let's just put it on record. I was not getting paid $​25 million," she said.

Cohen praised her positive attitude.

"Well, good for you for not being bitter about it, honestly," he said.

"I take it out on my Chihuahuas behind the scenes," she joked.

The former "Idol" judge said she has seen a "couple of episodes" of the reality singing competition reboot.

"Both Katy and Lionel (Richie, another judge) are friends, I love them," she said.

She quipped, "And I'd like to know Luke (Bryan)."

Abdul was a judge on the show when it premiered on Fox in 2002 until 2009. She co-judged with Randy Jackson and Simon Cowell.

In 2018, the revival premiered on ABC, featuring judges Richie, Perry and Bryan.

Abdul reminisced about her "Idol" days during an appearance on Season 1 winner Kelly Clarkson's new talk show in September.

She praised Clarkson's "A Moment Like This" performance: "It was a game changer."

Clarkson commented on the show's help in her rise to stardom.

"I would have never thought that show would have had the impact," said Clarkson, 37. "I mean look at what it did: The domino effect was crazy."
